'''Richard Armitage''' portrayed [[Thorin]] in the [[2012]]-[[2014|14]] [[The Hobbit (film series)|''The Hobbit'' film series]].<ref name="Announcement"/>

==History==
Richard was born in [[22 August|August 22]], [[1971]] at Leicester, England. He attended Huncote Primary School in Huncote Leicester. Later he attended Brockintron Collage in  Enderby where he studied music, playing the cello in school and in local orchestras as well as learning to play the flute. Then he went to Pattison College in Coventry where he learned to dance and act.<ref>Collins, Gemma. "Our Very Own All-Action Hero", ''Leicestershire and Rutland Life'', November 2009, p. 54</ref>

==Quotes==
{{blockquote|The Hobbit has been in my life since I was about 7 years old. It was one of the first books I managed to read from cover to cover, on my own. [...] When I was preparing for the role of [[Thorin]], I spent time reading many of Tolkien's other works, hunting down anything which would help me to imagine what it might be like to live as this 'very important Dwarf' ([[J.R.R. Tolkien|Tolkien]]'s words, not mine), and I listened to an old BBC radio recording of Tolkien reading his works.|Introduction, ''[[The Hobbit: The Desolation of Smaug: Visual Companion]]'', p. 5}}
